alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 26 at 8:16PM EDT until September 27 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EDT WEDNESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Strong north to south longshore current. There is also a Moderate Risk of rip currents expected for New Hanover. * WHERE...In North Carolina, Coastal New Hanover County. In South Carolina, Coastal Georgetown County. * WHEN...From 6 AM EDT Wednesday through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Longshore currents can sweep swimmers and surfers into rip currents, piers, jetties, and other hazardous areas. It may sweep swimmers off their feet, making it difficult to return to shore.
info.instruction: Caution should be used when in or near the water. Check with lifeguards before entering the ocean for possible hazards you may be swept into.
